isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - REASSEMBLE - QE COMPRESSOR

svcproc.title: QE COMPRESSOR

note.para: Since the valve body, head and unloader body are indexible, observe the marking of these parts at disassembly to make sure they are reassembled in the proper position.

svcproc.para: Some of the Service Assembly Kits contain pre-assembled components, but the following assembly sequence begins with all components separated.

step1.para: Place the valve body on a clean work surface with the intake valve surface facing upward. Carefully place the intake valve in the valve body recess and install the intake valve retainer on top (either side up for the valve and retainer) ( Figure 74).
Using a small punch, lightly stake the joint between outer edge of the intake valve retainer and valve body in three places about 120 degrees apart, only deep enough to retain the parts ( Figure 74).
Turn the valve body over and install the exhaust valve over the post in the valve body ( Figure 75).
Apply a thin coating of Teflon grease (or anti-seize, only if Teflon grease is not available) to the inside diameter (ID) of the exhaust valve retainer ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Apply Grease to Exhaust Valve Retainer

step1.para: Slide the exhaust valve retainer over the valve body post so that the end of the retainer with the groove faces upward ( Figure 77).
Align the new wave spring gaps 180 degrees from each other so they do not overlap ( Figure 78).
Place the new wave springs in the exhaust valve retainer groove ( Figure 79)

Determine the final orientation of the air intake location of the valve body with respect to the coolant ports of the head. Align the kidney-shaped slots in the head with the kidney-shaped slots in the head gasket ( Figure 80).

figure.caption: Figure 80. Align Slots In The Head With Head Gasket

step1.para: If orientation marks were made before disassembly, use them.
Assemble the valve body, head gasket (either side up), head, cover gasket (either side up) and cover ( Figure 81).

note.para: Be careful to avoid moving the wave springs out of the exhaust valve retainer groove.

step1.para: Align the bolt holes in the head cover, cover gasket, head, head gasket and valve body. Then install two head bolts in opposite corners for temporary alignment of parts ( Figure 82).

Lubricate the threads and under the head of the shorter center head bolt with clean engine oil (SAE 15W40) before installation. Install the center head bolt with washer through the center hole and tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 N•m) for now ( Figure 83).
Install the valve body gasket on the crankcase and align the bolt holes of the gasket with the holes in the crankcase ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Align Bolt Holes in Crankcase

step1.para: Install the head assembly on the valve body gasket on the crankcase and align with the holes in the crankcase using the two corner head bolts ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Align Head Assembly on Valve Body Gasket

step1.para: Temporarily start the corner head bolts by hand to hold the head assembly in place.
Lubricate under the head and threads of the two remaining head bolts with clean engine oil, SAE 15W40, before installation.
Install the two head bolts and washers and tighten to finger tight ( Figure 86).
Remove the two head bolts used to align the head assembly ( Figure 87).
Lubricate under the head and threads of the two removed head bolts with clean engine oil, SAE 15W40, before installation.
Install the two remaining head bolts and washers and tighten to finger tight ( Figure 88).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Install Remaining Head Bolts and Washers

step1.para: Tighten all five bolts in a crisscross pattern, starting with the center bolt first, ( using 5 ft-lbs. steps) to a final torque of 20 ft-lbs. (28 N•m), reaching 20 ft-lbs. (28 N•m) on the center head bolt first ( Figure 89)

note.para: It is recommended that no external or extra chassis or engine brackets be installed on the air compressor head bolts. However, if necessary, assure that adequate thread engagement exists after the added bracket is installed and the bolt affected must be tightened to 20 ft-lbs. (28 N•m).

step1.para: Install a new unloader vee seal into the unloader body groove ( Figure 90).

note.para: The seal must be installed with the grooved side inward.

step1.para: Liberally lubricate the unloader body bore above and below the unloader vee seal with high temperature grease (Accro Lube Teflon Grease or anti-seize if this grease is not available).
Install a new unloader O-ring on the unloader valve body ( Figure 91).
Use clean 15W40 oil or Accro Lube Teflon Grease (or anti-seize if this grease is not available) to lubricate the O-ring ( Figure 92).
Liberally lubricate the unloader body bore and unloader cap with high temperature grease (Accro Lube Teflon Grease or anti-seize if this grease is not available) ( Figure 93).

figure.caption: Figure 93. Lubricate Unloader Body Bore and Unloader Cap

step1.para: Install the unloader cap and unloader spring into the unloader body ( Figure 94).

figure.caption: Figure 94. Install Cap and Spring Into Unloader Body

note.para: The spring should have a dark blue stripe on it for identification.

step1.para: Lubricate under the head and threads of the unloader body bolts with clean engine oil (SAE 15W40) before installation ( Figure 95).

figure.caption: Figure 95. Lubricate Under Head and Threads

step1.para: Determine the final orientation of the unloader body with respect to inlet connection body. Then assemble and hold the unloader body assembly to the inlet connection body. Install the two shorter bolts with washers into the upper blind holes of the inlet connection body ( Figure 94). Tighten snugly for now.

note.para: The two unloader body screws must not be used to attach any brackets.
The longer bolts are used to mount the unloader assembly to the air compressor air intake on the valve body.

step1.para: Determine the final orientation of the unloader assembly to the air intake on the valve body. Install the two longer bolts with washers into the lower holes of the unloader assembly. Place a new air intake gasket over the bolts and position the unloader assembly on the valve body air intake ( Figure 96). Tighten all four bolts to 20 ft-lbs. (28 N•m).

note.para: It is recommended that no brackets should be installed on the unloader assembly bolts. However, if necessary, assure that adequate thread engagement exists after the added bracket is installed and the bolt affected must be tightened to 20 ft-lbs. (28 N•m).
